) Practitioner Priority Service (PPS) is a nationwide toll-free, account-related service for all types of tax practitioners. PPS serves tax practitioners as the ﬁrst point of contact for assistance regarding account-related issues. There no requirement for tax practitioners to use this service exclusively. A tax tioner may be deﬁned as any of the following: • Attorney • Certiﬁed Public Accountant • Enrolled Agent • Enrolled Actuary • Enrolled Retirement Plan Agent • Registered Tax Return Preparer • Reporting Agent • Third Party Designee Reminder: The above list is not all inclusive and additional probing may be necessary to ensure proper service is provided to all valid caller(s). ) There are two types of transcripts, external and internal: • External: These transcripts are available through a system accessible the general public, such as account transcripts and return transcripts through TDS. A limit of
transcripts per taxpayer may be provided when using TDS.
External: These transcripts are available through a system accessible to the general public, such as account transcripts and return transcripts through TDS. A limit of
transcripts per taxpayer may be provided when using TDS.

• Internal: These transcripts are available only through a system to the general public does not have access, for example, TXMOD, and IRPTR prints from IDRS. This list is not all inclusive and could include other types of internal transcripts. Internal transcripts must be sanitized before releasing, requests for this type of transcript will also limited to
internal transcripts per taxpayer. Caution: If the transcript request requires both internal and external transcripts, a total of
combined transcripts per taxpayer may be provided. (

) Transcripts designed for internal use require sanitization prior to providing them to a tax practitioner to ensure that inappropriate disclosures are not made. Electronically-sanitized transcripts must be provided in lieu of requiring manual sanitizing unless there is not one to meet the taxpayer’s needs or the caller requests a speciﬁc type of transcript. If the caller more than one type of transcript, honor the caller’s request. Follow on the Quick Command Code Tool to sanitize the documents. You must review the internal transcript manually to avoid disclosing conﬁdential information. A cover letter is not required when using Enterprise Electronic (EEFAX) for transcript requests since EEFAX automatically provides the sheet. However, a fax cover sheet must be used when using a manual fax machine. These requests will be processed within three (
) business days. See IRM
, Sanitizing IDRS Transcripts, for additional details. (

) You must review all transcripts thoroughly, including CC MFTRA and CC TXMOD. Managerial approval is not required. However, if you have any concerns, see your lead or manager prior to providing the transcripts to a practitioner. (

) If the caller requests a speciﬁc type of transcript (e.g., CC TXMODA, or ENMOD), provide the sanitized transcript. Note: ENMOD is considered part of the account and if requested, should be provided with the proper authorization form. Caution: If the establishment date does not fall within the years/periods provided on Form
or Form
do not provide ENMOD information of the authority granted. (

) Transcripts that are not electronically sanitized must be manually sanitized photocopied prior to being released to a caller. Mail the photocopy and the original as classiﬁed waste. , Mailing and Faxing Tax Account Information, and IRM
, Sanitizing IDRS Transcripts. (
